channel.title: books – Indigenous Values Initiative
channel.description: NYA WEÑHA SKÄ NOÑH: Thank you for being well

item.title: Neighbor to Neighbor: Nation to Nation (Digital Edition)
item.dc:creator: Adam DJ Brett
item.description: Digital Download Published by Neighbors of the Onondaga Nation (NOON) Revised & Expanded 2014
item.content:encoded:
Digital Edition

This booklet is dedicated to the continuing friendship between the peoples of the Haudenosaunee and Central, New York. We share a difficult history but are united in our love for the land, water animals and plant life in our passion for justice and in our hope for the future generations. Proceeds from the sale of this booklet go toward furthering the educational and advocacy work of Neighbors of the Onondaga Nation.

Published by Neighbors of the Onondaga Nation (NOON)
Revised & Expanded 2014
This is a digital download

item.title: Commemorative Booklet on the Origins of Lacrosse
item.dc:creator: Adam DJ Brett
item.description: The Deyhontsigwa’ehs- The Creator’s Game, Lacrosse Weekend Brochure educates people about the Haudenosaunee and the origins and importance of democracy and Lacrosse.  The origins of lacrosse come from the Haudenosaunee and all funds from your tax-free purchases go to promote the Indigenous values of this game.
item.content:encoded:
The Deyhontsigwa’ehs- The Creator’s Game, Lacrosse Weekend Brochure educates people about the Haudenosaunee and the origins and importance of democracy and Lacrosse.

Table of Contents

  • A Message from Onondaga Clan Mothers
  • Deyhontsigwa’es/Lacrosse: The Creator’s Game. by Kent Lyons
  • NYA WEÑHA SKÄ NOÑH Thank you for being well; a wellness that depends on proper relationships with each other and the natural world.
  • The Creator’s Game Haudenosaunee Origins at Sacred Onondaga Lake
  • The Haudenosaunee Influence on the Founding Fathers
  • Alf Jacques: Wooden Stick Maker of the Onondaga Nation
  • Deyhontsigwa’ehs (They Bump Hips): Lacrosse of the Onondaga Nation
  • Lacrosse is a Family Affair by Lyle Thompson from an interview with Bob Liff
  • Thanksgiving Address: Greeting to the Natural World-Words That Come Before All Else (in Hebrew and English)
